title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 28-2.9 - Proficiency examination
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 28-2.9 - Proficiency examination

State Regulations

If the Committee on the Professions determines that the
applicant is otherwise qualified to practice a licensed profession based upon
his or her prior disciplinary history, but has failed to remain current with
developments in the profession, and a substantial question is presented as to
the applicant's current fitness to enter into the active practice of the
profession, the Committee on the Professions may require that the applicant
take and obtain satisfactory grades on a proficiency examination satisfactory
to the department prior to the issuance of a license, endorsement, or limited
permit. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
28-2.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
